intro: Serrafalcus verticillatus, commonly known as the spiral leaf fern, is a unique vascular plant characterized by its distinctive spiraling arrangement of leaves. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. The plant features slender, wiry rhizomes that support its delicate, lanceolate fronds. Its leaves are typically arranged in a tight, helical pattern around the stem, giving it a visually striking appearance. Serrafalcus verticillatus thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in moist forest understories.
